greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle whose (i,j)-th entry is binomial(i,j)*7^(i-j).
comment: T(i,j) is the number of i-permutations of 8 objects a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h, with repetition allowed, containing j a's. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 21 2007
Triangle of coefficients in the expansion of (7 + x)^n, where n is a nonnegative integer. - _Zagros Lalo_, Jul 21 2018
reference: Shara Lalo and Zagros Lalo, Polynomial Expansion Theorems and Number Triangles, Zana Publishing, 2018, ISBN: 978-1-9995914-0-3, pp. 44, 48
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
B. N. Cyvin et al., Isomer enumeration of unbranched catacondensed polygonal systems with pentagons and heptagons, Match, No. 34 (Oct 1996), pp. 109-121.
formula: Cube of lower triangular normalized Binomial matrix.
Numerators of lower triangle of (a( i, j ))^3 where a( i, j ) = binomial(i-1, j-1)/2^(i-1) if j <= i, 0 otherwise.
T(0,0) = 1; T(n,k) = 7 T(n-1,k) + T(n-1,k-1) for k = 0...n; T(n,k)=0 for n or k < 0. - _Zagros Lalo_, Jul 21 2018
maple: for i from 0 to 8 do seq(binomial(i, j)*7^(i-j), j = 0 .. i) od; # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Dec 21 2007
mathematica: Table[CoefficientList[ Expand[(7 + x)^n], x], {n, 0, 8}] // Flatten  (* _Zagros Lalo_, Jul 22 2018 *)
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
ext: Simpler definition from _N. J. A. Sloane_
